definition: Cantonese/short name for Guangdong 廣東|广东[Guang3 dong1]
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: We can't let the art of Cantonese opera wither away.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能任由粵劇藝術日漸凋零。

sentences.english: Cantonese Opera performer sits backstage at a theater in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 一名粵劇演員坐在劇院後臺的臺階上。

sentences.english: Experience the piercing sounds of Cantonese opera in the West Kowloon Cultural District.
sentences.chinese: 去西九龍文化區聽一聽非常有穿透力的粵劇。

sentences.english: There are three main Cantonese opera performers recorded in this opera.
sentences.chinese: 該劇記錄了三個主要的粵劇演員。

sentences.english: This beautiful foreigner sings Cantonese opera.
sentences.chinese: 這個美麗的外國女人唱粵劇。

definition: military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
